content.description: Start on an undercling three finger crimp, heel hook around the corner and 4-finger 1/2 pad crimp.  Go to anything that looks decent with the right.
content.location:
The boulder immediately downhill towards the canyon from '

Incrimination

.'

content.description: Just a North-facing boulder with tons of little pockets to mess around in. Good traverse or go straight up.  Good for warming up.
content.location: After getting to the first campsite, park, walk down the road 20 feet.  It's on your left at the bottom of the hill.

content.description: Start is full extension between either a gaston/thumb press and a three finger pocket.  foot-hand match to get to a beefing pocket to the top out.
content.location: Walk the straight line between parking down the hill, past the Warmup Boulder, up the hill between two boulders.  Far end of the left boulder.

content.description: Climb up the middle of the boulder to the apex from a sit start. SDS on good pockets.
content.location: It is a few hundred yards before you drive up to the Heart Boulder. Off to the left of the road, you can see it.

content.description: Located in Ned's Wonderland of Rock in the southern most area right off the side of the road.  Jump start to big moves.
Start in two lower pockets, throw to a sloper pocket, match hands, switch to an undercling with a dyno to the top out.
Sit start on the left side of the west face with your right hand in a sloper pocket, your left hand on nub/crimp. Climb up and right to the point and top out right.
content.location: This is on the short, Hershey kiss looking blob in front of Desirable Block.

content.description: About 18 feet of cryptic crimping leads to decent holds near the lip. Start standing. You can also add a few moves into the start via down and right, which might bump the grade up a notch. This is an incredible boulder and boulder problem. It might be 3/4 stars just because the rock quality is less than perfect. Tread lightly, watch where you step, and try to minimize wear, as the area has fragile flora and fauna. Stout for the grade.
content.protection: It is quite tall, so a pad or two would help.
content.location: On the obvious Heart Boulder, this route goes up just right of center on the north face.

content.description: Climb up the far left line on the east face.
content.protection: It has a flat landing but is slight highball.
content.location: It is on the boulder 60 feet or so east of the Heart Boulder on its east face.

content.description: Sloping double-pockets up an arete.  Small crimps towards the top.  Top-out is a texture crimp and whatever you can find.
content.protection: 1-2 pads.  Left side gets chossy for footholds.
content.location:
To the left of the

Unnamed

V3.  This one is on the arete.

content.description: A low crux leads to heady, vertical edges at the top. You'll cry with joy at the sinker jug finish. Keep your head about you.
content.protection: Lots of pads and a few spotters. It is as good as a landing gets for a problem this high. There's a tree and a bolt somewhere on top for TR. Be careful, we broke a few holds off, but stick to the black, most of the tan is junk except for a key foot.
content.location: Between the two parking lots, climb the obvious black streak up the triangle-shaped boulder.
